Welcome to Getting Started with Sphinx's documentation!¶

class pyprofiler.lshbuilder.LSHBuilder(tarfile_ortho=None, h5_oma=None, taxa=None, masterTree=None, saving_name=None, numperm=256, treeweights=None, taxfilter=None, taxmask=None, verbose=False)¶

This class contains the stuff you need to make a phylogenetic profiling database with input orthxml files and a taxonomic tree

You must either input an OMA hdf5 file or provide a function to generate orthoxml files for each orthologous groupself.

You can provide a species tree or use the ncbi taxonomy with a list of taxonomic codes for all the species in your db

class pyprofiler.profiler.Profiler(lshforestpath=None, hashes_h5=None, mat_path=None, oma=False, tar=None, nsamples=256)¶

A profiler object allows the user to query the LSH with HOGs and get a list of result HOGs back

static allvall_hashes(hashes)¶

Given a dict of hogs:hashes, returns generate an all v all jaccard distance matrix. :param hashes: a dict of hogs:hashes :return: hashmat

allvall_nx(hashes, thresh=None)¶

Given a dict of hogs:hashes, returns generate an all v all jaccard distance matrix. :param hashes: a dict of hogs:hashes :return: hashmat

get_vpairs()¶

get pairwise distance matrix of OMA all v all #not finished :param fam: an oma fam :return sparesemat: a mat with all taxa in Oma with nonzero entries where this protein is found :return densemat: a mat with the taxa covered by the fam

hog_query(hog_id=None, fam_id=None, k=100)¶

Given a hog_id or a fam_id as a query, returns a dictionary containing the results of the LSH. :param hog_id: query hog id :param fam_id: query fam id :return: list containing the results of the LSH for the given query

hog_query_OMA(hog_id=None, fam_id=None, k=100)¶

Untested, Given a hog_id or a fam_id as a query, returns a dictionary containing the results of the LSH. Generates the tree profile and hashes on the fly :param hog_id: query hog id :param fam_id: query fam id :return: list containing the results of the LSH for the given query

hog_query_sorted(hog_id=None, fam_id=None, k=100)¶

Given a hog_id or a fam_id as a query, returns a dictionary containing the results of the LSH. :param hog_id: query hog id :param fam_id: query fam id :return: list containing the results of the LSH for the given query

hog_v_hog(hogs)¶

give two hogs returns jaccard distance. :param hog1 , hog2: str hog id :return: jaccard score

pull_hashes(hoglist)¶

Given a list of hog_ids , returns a dictionary containing their hashes. This uses the hdf5 file to get the hashvalues :param hog_id: query hog id :param fam_id: query fam id :return: a dict containing the hash values of the hogs in hoglist

pull_matrows(fams)¶

given a list of fams return the submatrix containing their profiles

:return:fams sorted, sparse mat

retmat_mp(traindf, nworkers=25, chunksize=50)¶

function used to create training matrix with pairs of hogs. calculate_x will return the difference and union of two binary vectors generated by pyham

retmat_mp_profiles(fams, nworkers=25, chunksize=50)¶

function used to create dataframe containing binary profiles and trees of fams

return_profile_OTF(fam)¶

Returns profiles as binary vectors for use with optimisation pipelines

return_profile_OTF_DCA(fam, lock=None)¶

Returns profiles as strings for use with DCA pipelines just concatenate the numpy arrays and use the tostring function to generate an input "alignment"

static sort_hashes(query_hash, hashes)¶

Given a dict of hogs:hashes, returns a sorted array of hogs and jaccard distances relative to query hog. :param query hash: weighted minhash of the query :param hashes: a dict of hogs:hashes :return: sortedhogs, jaccard

worker(i, inq, retq)¶

this worker function is for parallelization of generation of binary vector for use with optimisation pipelines
